content.body: Congrats on getting customizable `<select>` landed jarhar (and Domenic)!
Are we getting a blog post?
I think we should, if Joey's up for it!

content.body: I just cloned whatwg/streams and downloaded close to 2 GiB⁉️
Oh sigh. I committed a cardinal sin. (I did not remove the PR number from the commit title.)
Yeah, that must be it. WPT is huge.
Also, what is going on with GitHub. I keep having to approve the workflow of a branch I'm actively pushing to.

It'd be great if we could get https://github.com/html5lib/html5lib-tests/pull/178 updated and merged too. Else parsers might run into issues or update and not quite match the spec (if they base it on the tests)
Agreed. That doesn't appear to be in a great state according to the comments. jarhar ^^
content.formatted_body: Agreed. That doesn't appear to be in a great state according to the comments. jarhar ^^

content.body: Did we ever consider not allowing javascript: URLs for `navigation.navigate` or would that be problematic by making the API less powerful than `location.href` ?
content.formatted_body: Did we ever consider not allowing javascript: URLs for navigation.navigate or would that be problematic by making the API less powerful than location.href ?

content.body: Someone raised it on the Chromium issue tracker once. They weren't able to explain what it solves, when `location.href` exists...
content.formatted_body: Someone raised it on the Chromium issue tracker once. They weren't able to explain what it solves, when location.href exists...

content.body: I get the point. It does feel a bit unfortunate to me that we are introducing a new script sink.
I of course don't actually believe that you can create a reasonable secure website by somehow protecting all scripts sink manually or something like that!
is there an active CSS matrix room?
